schemas.purpose: JSON schema for validating custom persona creation inputs (validates name, description, expertise, use_cases, communication_style with strict constraints)
schemas.notes: This is a reusable validation contract for custom persona inputs. Enforces naming conventions (alphanumeric + hyphens/underscores), length constraints (3-50 chars for name), and array size limits (3-10 expertise areas). Could be valuable in papertrail as a standard for persona validation across projects.

validators.purpose: Multi-stage validation pipeline for custom persona creation (schema → semantic → quality validation with PersonaValidator class)
validators.notes: This is a comprehensive validation framework with 3 stages: (1) Schema validation (JSON schema + Pydantic), (2) Semantic validation (coherence, uniqueness, alignment), (3) Quality validation (coverage, best practices). The PersonaValidator class is reusable and could be generalized for other validation workflows. However, it's currently tightly coupled to persona-specific logic (e.g., checking persona name uniqueness against base personas).
